anyOf.description: By default the outpout is presented as string. If this option gets activated, it will resolve the data automatically.
anyOf.title: Resolve Data

anyOf.description: By default the launch just include the container ID. If this option gets activated, it will resolve the data automatically.
anyOf.title: Resolve Data

returnAll.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit
returnAll.title: Return All

limit.description: Max number of results to return
limit.title: Limit

prevContainerId.description: If set, the output will be retrieved from the container after the specified previous container ID
prevContainerId.title: Prev Container ID

prevStatus.description: If set, allows to define which status was previously retrieved on user-side
prevStatus.title: Prev Status

prevRuntimeEventIndex.description: If set, the container's runtime events will be returned in the response starting from the provided previous runtime event index
prevRuntimeEventIndex.title: Pre Runtime Event Index

value.description: Value to set for the argument key
value.title: Value

key.description: Name of the argument key to add
key.title: Key

maxInstanceCount.description: If set, the agent will only be launched if the number of already running instances is below the specified number
maxInstanceCount.title: Max Instance Count

value.description: Value to set for the argument key
value.title: Value

key.description: Name of the argument key to add
key.title: Key

saveArgument.description: If true, argument will be saved as the default launch options for the agent
saveArgument.title: Save Argument

argumentsJson.description: Agent argument. Can either be a JSON string or a plain object. The argument can be retrieved with buster.argument in the agent’s script.
argumentsJson.title: Arguments (JSON)

manualLaunch.description: Whether the agent will be considered as "launched manually"
manualLaunch.title: Manual Launch

bonusArgumentJson.description: Agent bonus argument. Can either be a JSON string or a plain object. This bonus argument is single-use, it will only be used for the current launch. If present, it will be merged with the original argument, resulting in an effective argument that can be retrieved with buster.argument in the agent’s script.
bonusArgumentJson.title: Bonus Argument (JSON)

anyOf.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression
anyOf.title: Agent Name or ID

anyOf.title: Agent Name or ID
